logic

Class Recurring

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Recurring

  • public class Recurring
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with the adding and updating of recurring task timings. It is called by various classes such as Logic, Add, Done and Edit.
    Author:
    ChongYan

    • Constructor Summary

      Recurring()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Recurring

        public Recurring()

    • Method Detail

      • setAllRecurringEventTimes

        public static void setAllRecurringEventTimes(common.TaskObject task)
                                      throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by Add or Edit.
        When a new recurring event is initially added, Add calls this method to generate a series of recurrences for this event.
        When a recurring event is edited, Edit calls this method to generate the new timings for the event.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject for addition of all recurring timings
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException

      • setAllRecurringDeadlineTimes

        public static void setAllRecurringDeadlineTimes(common.TaskObject task)
                                         throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by Add or Edit.
        When a new recurring deadline is initially added, Add calls this method to generate a series of recurrences for this deadline.
        When a recurring deadline is edited, Edit calls this method to generate the new timings for the deadline.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject for addition of all recurring timings
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException

      • updateRecurringEvents

        public static void updateRecurringEvents(java.util.ArrayList<common.TaskObject> taskList)
                                  throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by logic when AdultTaskFinder is launched. Searches for all recurring events and passes it to updateEvent to determine if the recurring event has to be updated, and updates the event if necessary.
        Parameters:
        taskList - List of tasks stored by AdultTaskFinder.
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException - Customised exception called when there is a fault performing any recurrence related command.

      • updateRecurringDeadlines

        public static void updateRecurringDeadlines(java.util.ArrayList<common.TaskObject> taskList)
                                     throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by logic when AdultTaskFinder is launched. Searches for all recurring deadlines and passes it to updateDeadline to determine if the recurring deadline has to be updated, and updates the deadline if necessary
        Parameters:
        taskList - List of tasks stored by AdultTaskFinder
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException

      • updateEvent

        public static void updateEvent(common.TaskObject task,
                               java.util.ArrayList<common.TaskObject> taskList,
                               java.lang.String status)
                        throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by updateRecurringEvents or a Done object to update an event to the desired status (either completed or overdue). Exception is thrown if the desired status is invalid.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject to be updated.
        taskList - Stores all the tasks the user has.
        status - The desired status for updating. Can only be either "overdue" or "completed".
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException

      • updateDeadline

        public static void updateDeadline(common.TaskObject task,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<common.TaskObject> taskList,
                                  java.lang.String status)
                           throws RecurrenceException
        Method called by updateRecurringDeadlines or a Done object to update a deadline to the desired status (either completed or overdue). Exception is thrown if the desired status is invalid.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject to be updated
        taskList - Stores all the tasks the user has
        status - The desired status for updating. Can only be either "overdue" or "completed"
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException

      • updateInfiniteRecurrence

        public static void updateInfiniteRecurrence(common.TaskObject task)
                                     throws RecurrenceException
        Method which adds a new occurrence to the end of the recurring task's timings, if the recurring task is infinitely recurring.
        Parameters:
        task - TaskObject which is infinitely recurring.
        Throws:
        RecurrenceException - thrown if there are problems generating the next recurrence in the methods it calls.
